Package org.wildfly.common.selector

Classes which implement a selector pattern, which enables a global provider of some service to be selected depending on context.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GlobalSelector<T>
    A selector which always returns one global instance.
    Selector<T>
    A selector for an object which is obtainable via static context.
    Selector.Getter<T>
    An efficient, unchecked getter for a selector for a given class.
    SelectorPermission
    Permission to access a specific selector.
    ThreadLocalSelector<T>
    A thread local selector implementation.

Package org.wildfly.common.selector Description

Classes which implement a selector pattern, which enables a global provider of some service to be selected depending on context. Several selector implementations are provided, such as GlobalSelector and ThreadLocalSelector. Custom implementations can be created by extending the Selector base class.
Author:
David M. Lloyd
